channel.title: Port forwarding issue
channel.description:
OK first off, please do not tell me to go follow a guide on how to port forward. I have done it all correctly 99% (apparently). My problem is that when I run (in this order) No-ip, Server, Utorrent, It works fine. When I turn that off for say a compile and restart, it unchecks my port forward option on the router site. (192.168.#.#) If anyone knows a fix to this PLEASE.. help is very much appreciated.
-Thanks-

item.title: Port forwarding issue
item.dc:creator: @i_am_infamy i am infamy
item.description:
@i_am_infamy wrote:

Valzor:

it really would just be better if i could find a fix to the problem, I haven’t started the project yet so I want to be updating a lot for the next few days

That would be better, but why not do what the previous post said, Do weekly updates or 3 day updates, before you release make sure you have coding well enough for 3 days atleast. But if anything contact your router company.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding issue
item.dc:creator: @jake.bellotti jake.bellotti
item.description:
@jake.bellotti wrote:

Utorrent isn’t the best, as it is only made to temporarily open the port. Anyway, there i think it’s called JRebel or something, that allows you to update without restarting. Check it out.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding issue
item.dc:creator: @dragnnight0 dragnnight0
item.description:
@dragnnight0 wrote:

if you give me the name of your router i can do some research for you might be able too tell you how to porforward your router specifically

Edit: like weather its belkin or ASUS , linkleys something and the year the router is might help me

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding issue
item.dc:creator: @g0dp0wr g0dp0wr
item.description:
@g0dp0wr wrote:

hmm definitely could just be your router consistently updating, id check the settings of your router and make sure it doesnt have like an auto update or reset thing going on.

Read full topic

item.description:

yes I can get online with the no-ip, even had a friend get on with me

item.title: Port forwarding issue
item.dc:creator: @g0dp0wr g0dp0wr
item.description:
@g0dp0wr wrote:

hmm interesting ya, honestly i think it could just be your router… mine hadnt done that but mine was very anal about exactly what i needed to portforward.

and by online you mean you can access it from lets say mopar, using your no-ip address not using 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding issue
item.dc:creator: @jake.bellotti jake.bellotti
item.description:
@jake.bellotti wrote:

Make an update schedule, like an update a week. But dont update every time you spawn a goblin or whatsoever.
